purpose: Factor delta4 defects into four sector charges; compute minimal single-defect cycles; verify Z2 curvature parity; weld sector V4 to 2T cosets used in 24-clock mapping.

Z2_field_tensor_support.interpretation: Z2 curvature cochain supported on the four delta4 edges; evaluation on a cycle is XOR of crossings.

parity_rule_verification.statement: For fundamental cycles: hol(C)^3 = e* iff cycle crosses an odd number of delta4 edges. Verified on all 67 fundamental cycles and 2000 random chord cycles.

sector_V4_weld.statement: The 4 sector indices in the 24-clock form a V4 (Klein) structure, matching the A4 double-transposition coset reps used to enumerate 2T as 4 cosets of <tau>.

notes: Each delta4 edge yields a canonical shortest 'single-defect' loop (cycle) with order-6 holonomy and center class e*.
These four loops act as the cleanest generators for discussing localized flux/defect charges, while the measured Z2 curvature seen by hol^3 depends on the XOR of all four crossings.
This matches the intuition: local Z6 transport (tau) with a central Z2 obstruction; 4 sectors x Z6 = 24-state clock; sector index carries a V4 coset label.
